alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 29 at 2:17AM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 30 inches with the higher amounts expected above 9000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 60 mph, especially on Thursday, in exposed areas. * WHERE...Sierra Madres and Snowy Mountain Ranges * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snow mobilers likely to become disoriented and lost with very poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An extended period of light to moderate snow is expected tonight through Saturday morning. Highest snowfall rates and heaviest snowfall will occur late Thursday through Friday. Snow will tapper off Saturday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
